question.title: Creating methods for each @NamedNativeQuery in a list of @NamedNativeQueries
question.body:
I am working with some older code that has a fairly large catalog of existing @NamedNativeQueries in a JPA repository:

@Repository
@NamedNativeQueries({
    @NamedNativeQuery(name = "query1", query = "SELECT STUFF from STUFF where True"),
    @NamedNativeQuery(name = "query2", query = "select distinct STUFF from something"),
    @NamedNativeQuery(name = "query3", query = "select count(*) STUFF from some pattern"),
    //.../
    @NamedNativeQuery(name = "queryN", query = "select STUFF where lots of filters)")
})
public interface StuffRepository extends JpaRepository<Stuff, Long> {
// Except I don't have method signatures written out for query1, query2, query3,...,queryN
}

Is there some annotation I could add or create so I wouldn't have to write out method signatures for each @NamedNativeQuery?

answers.body:
JPA does not provide a built-in way to automatically map @NamedNativeQuery definitions to repository method signatures without explicitly declaring those methods in the interface. Each named native query still needs a corresponding method in your StuffRepository if you want to call it through the repository layer.

Thereâ€™s no annotation or auto-wiring magic that will let you skip writing method signatures for each @NamedNativeQuery.
